column4: Please help, I have a hard drive and only I the user who installed ubuntu can read and write to it, I have 2 more users whom I want to grant access to read and write. How do I do that ?
you've already created those users on the system?
yes
okay, and they need to be able to access those files locally?
yes and be able to write and read to the hard drive
which ubuntu version are you using (not sure if that makes any difference, but still)
great, then I can just do the same things as you should, and we both should see the same results. Hang on, I'm gonna try out some stuff
sudo chmod 777 /media/disk   worked
My guess is the best way to do this is to create a new group to which you should add all the users that require access, and then set the proper group permissions to all files
that should work as well, yes, but now the entire world can access that disk and it's files ;)
if that's no problem, then you're done
that should do it, that is what I needed. What did you have in mind, I would like to know as I can learn soemthing new here.
a bit more secure approach would be, as I described above, to creat a separate group and add all neccesary users to that group
and then only change the group permissions on all files
How would I  only change the group permissions on all files ?
chgrp -R [groupname]  *
and then chmod 770 *
liek this?    chgrp -R [groupname]  /media/disk ?
that _should_ do it, yes... but you have to add the specified group first, of course
got it, thanks.
and add the users to that group :)

I use that method to share photos and media files with my gf... there's a small catch, though - newly created / copied files won't get the proper permissions by default. You have to fix that manually every time. There should be a solution to that, but I havn't had the time to look for it yet.
